content: In the Harry Potter series, what magical artifact was said to grant its owner immortality?

In the Harry Potter series, the magical artifact said to grant its owner immortality is the Philosopher's Stone (also known as the Sorcerer's Stone in some editions). However, it's important to note that the Stone doesn't grant literal immortality but instead creates the Elixir of Life, which can be used to extend one's life indefinitely when consumed. The pursuit of the Philosopher's Stone plays a central role in the first book and film of the series.
